img.data-cycle-title: Congratulations to our GlenOak Girls Basketball team for defeating Stow in the D1 Regional Semi-Final game on March 3. Go Eagles!
img.alt: Congratulations to our GlenOak Girls Basketball team for defeating Stow in the D1 Regional Semi-Final game on March 3. Go Eagles!

img.data-cycle-title: Congratulations Team Avondale! Just Plain Dance 2020 Champions! Collectively all nine Plain Local schools raised over $18,000 for the Arts during the January fundraiser.
img.alt: Congratulations Team Avondale! Just Plain Dance 2020 Champions! Collectively all nine Plain Local schools raised over $18,000 for the Arts during the January fundraiser.

img.data-cycle-title: The staff vs. students wheelchair basketball game during our annual Celebrate Diversity event was a great success!
img.alt: The staff vs. students wheelchair basketball game during our annual Celebrate Diversity event was a great success!

img.data-cycle-title: Make sure you check out the 'Athletics' tab on the main website for updates on our GlenOak teams!
img.alt: Make sure you check out the 'Athletics' tab on the main website for updates on our GlenOak teams!

img.data-cycle-title: Congratulations to the cast of the fall ballet of Cinderalla at GlenOak High School presented by the Plain Local Schools Foundation and Alumni Association.
img.alt: Congratulations to the cast of the fall ballet of Cinderalla at GlenOak High School presented by the Plain Local Schools Foundation and Alumni Association.

img.data-cycle-title: Congratulations to the GlenOak Volleyball team of their historic season, finishing as regional runner-ups!
img.alt: Congratulations to the GlenOak Volleyball team of their historic season, finishing as regional runner-ups!

img.data-cycle-title: Pro Football Hall of Famer, Marshall Faulk takes time to talk with GlenOak football players after speaking at the Plain Local Schools convocation in August.
img.alt: Pro Football Hall of Famer, Marshall Faulk takes time to talk with GlenOak football players after speaking at the Plain Local Schools convocation in August.

img.data-cycle-title: The Frazer "Fierce Females" spoke at Convocation in August about their mission of Learn, Lead and Love.
img.alt: The Frazer "Fierce Females" spoke at Convocation in August about their mission of Learn, Lead and Love.

img.data-cycle-title: That Class of 2020 graduates Tuesday, May 26, 20 at the Canton Memorial Civic Center.
img.alt: That Class of 2020 graduates Tuesday, May 26, 20 at the Canton Memorial Civic Center.

img.data-cycle-title: Congratulations to GlenOak High School for being named one of the best high schools in the nation!
img.alt: Congratulations to GlenOak High School for being named one of the best high schools in the nation!

img.data-cycle-title: GlenOak High School has been approved as an International Baccalaureate World School!
img.alt: GlenOak High School has been approved as an International Baccalaureate World School!

img.style: width: 100px; height: 125px; float: left; margin-left: 5px; margin-right: 5px;

div.p:
I hope this message finds you and your family safe!Â Thank you for your continued support and encouragement during this uncertain time.Â I want to highlight our parents and community members who are first responders, health care providers, and those who are keeping our essential businesses running for the entire community.Â The Plain Local School District salutes you and your service.Â Thank you for being Champions!
I realize graduation has been a hot topic in the area this weekend.Â We will announce our decision this week after hearing the Governorâs remarks on Monday and talking with other local school districts.Â These are difficult decision and I am trying to balance the safety of our entire community and honoring our seniors.Â
The district will also release a frequently asked question document for the Class of 2020Â this week.Â It will outline all relevant information on end of year activities and how we will honor and celebrate our seniors.Â
Additionally, grading guidelines will be released this week.Â The document will outline grades K-12 and will be located on our website. Teachers and principals will be available with questions or concerns.
Finally, I personally understand the emotions regarding all seniors.Â My son is a senior and these decisions are very personal.Â Please understand that all of my decisions are thought through as a parent as I continue to try to find a balance between safety and honoring each senior and their family.Â I ask everyone to be patient and understand these decisions are not taken lightly from my position as superintendent.Â Thank you for your support.Â Â

Go Eagles!
Respectfully,Â
Brent May
Superintendent
330-492-3500
mayb@plainlocal.org
